content.rendered:
asdfghjkl I am so fkn excited to share this with yall!!!!!! I have been having SO much fun designing and decorating everything for my new house. At first it all seemed a little overwhelming, trying to figure out furniture and design for the house because I’m NOT a creative aesthetic person hahah but I ended up being obsessed with this process. The key word for this is PATIENCE. It’s only been six weeks since we moved in, but at I started ordering and purchasing furniture a month prior to moving in. Furniture takes forever to come these days, and it was my first priority over art, so now that all the furniture is in, it’s time to focus on that next. So, to reiterate!!! (because I know people will message me and tell me things Im missing, cough cough, carpets I KNOW)- I’m still not 100% there yet but I’m so excited with how it has turned out so far and cant wait to take you on a mini house/decor tour. All links below are things I purchased myself, none sponsored. I just wanted to share with you guys where I found everything and give you a way to quickly find it if you’re looking for something similar! ALRIGHTY- enjoy!

Master Bathroom:

I really wanted to try and keep everything in the bathroom as natural and clutter free as possible! It’s such a calming space for me and helps set the tone for my day as I get ready each morning. I found these super cute woven baskets that I literally just dump all of my stuff in (hair dryer, straightener, all of my random projects that would normally be on your counter!) So nice not to see bottles, brushes, hair tools, and random things scattered across the countertop and on the shelves.

Bath Runner: https://www.cb2.com/sadie-black-bath-runner-24×60/s297912

Organizational baskets: Luna Black & Natural Baskets from CB2

Ladder, not the exact same one but a similar style from Pottery Barn: Rustic Reclaimed Wood Ladder

Master Bedroom:

SIDE NOTEEEEE Im no where near done with my master bedroom, but wanted to give you guys a glimpse of what it’s STARTED to look like.

Nightstands: https://shopdesigntap.com/collections/shop-furniture/products/suki-burnished-black-nightstand?_pos=1&_sid=ab5d47db8&_ss=r

Bed frame: https://rh.com/catalog/product/product.jsp?productId=prod7450494

Silk Pillowcases: https://blissy.com/collections/pillowcases (FROM MY GOOD FRIEND VICTORIA FOR MY BDAYYYY THANK YOU I LOVE YOU!)

Linen Bedding: https://www.potterybarn.com/products/belgian-flax-linen-duvet-cover-flax/?pkey=s~White%20Belgian%20Flax%20Linen%20Duvet%20Cover~36

Weighted Blanket: (helps my anxiety, its warm and fuzzy, and cute to go on top of the bed!) https://www.google.com/shopping/product/2242777497963236508?q=white+fluffy+anxiety+weighted+blanket&prds=epd:5551227660286699637,prmr:3,eto:5551227660286699637_1,rto:1,tpim:CPmvm4mnpfy6uQEQ2cqC0Yz5hNYOGPDG9CoiA1VTRCjg6YaMBjC-Tg&utm_medium=tu_prop&utm_content=eid-lsjeuxoeqt&utm_campaign=10046

Guest Bedroom:

This guest bedroom came together quite nicely!! I actually had this bed at my last apartment and I loved it so I brought it to my new house! It’s white and bright and just goes perfectly with the rest of the house. I got all of the bedding at Target (if you live near a Target with a solid home section, it should literally be the first stop you make when shopping for your new place)! They have everything there…I got a ton of cute decorations too and things for my bathroom like trash bins, soap dispensers, candles and faux plants. Also, that wall art is literally from my college dorm room lol but I’ve always loved it and it actually goes pretty well with the space I think!

Bed Quilt: I can’t find exact one because I purchased in store URGH but if you type in “black and white bedding” on Target.com you will find some amazing VERY similar ones!

White Pillows: Threshold Throw Pillows from Target

Black Pillow: Oversized Chunky Knit Throw Pillow from Target

Side tables: Prepac Milo Mid Century Modern 2 Drawer Nightstand from Walmart

Lamps: Wooden Accent Lamps from Target

Dining and living room:

I think this area is probably my favorite part of the house! I was really going for a mix between beachy and farmhouse chic and I found so many pieces that fit this aesthetic pretty perfectly! I actually got the Restoration Hardware table at an outlet and saved so much money on it! It’s crazy…there were a couple of minor scratches and dents on it and it was on MAJOR discount. The dining chairs are from Pottery Barn and I loved how they pulled everything together with the black light fixture above the table and the black on the fireplace as well!

One of my friends told me about this unreal spot called Malibu Design Center!

Dining room table: Restoration Hardware Belgian Trestle Teak Dining Table 

Dining chairs: Pottery Barn Westan Wood Dining Chairs 

Sofa: Malibu Market Design

Coffee table with matching side table: Malibu Market Design 

Side chairs: CB2 Gwyneth Black Boucle Chair

(All plants from a local plant shop)

Office:

I actually had this coffee table and sofa in my old apartment and we needed some furniture to make the office look a little more complete so we thought these pieces were the perfect addition! And the sofa is SO comfortable so there is no way I was getting rid of it! Disregard the wires along the desk I v lazily took this pic haha

Sofa: West Elm Haven 2 Piece Terminal Chaise Sectional

Coffee Table: West Elm Volume Pedestal Coffee Table

Standing Desk: https://www.amazon.com/FEZIBO-Adjustable-Electric-Standing-Tabletop/dp/B099ZSG85C/ref=sr_1_21?crid=3GHULQ3JWU0MK&dchild=1&keywords=white+standing+desk&qid=1635206724&qsid=133-2982967-2555436&sprefix=white+standing+desk%2Caps%2C153&sr=8-21&sres=B07W42DSG8%2CB08SBL81LT%2CB0829FV8MT%2CB099ZTMGYQ%2CB07W8W8XKV%2CB08GLCN84Y%2CB08KXW53KY%2CB07V2PGCG3%2CB09B1MJB1W%2CB099WSYYWV%2CB07RDVMYV4%2CB08HGV69LC%2CB08LMXSMTR%2CB099ZSG85C%2CB07MT7GQWF%2CB07SJ8XL24%2CB08GL9XWCP%2CB09C64YDLH%2CB098KYWJ9C%2CB0785MTM8B&srpt=DESK

Trinkets on shelves are all from local Home Goods or Target. Still needs work haha

Gym:

It has been my lifelong dream to have a custom at home gym and holyyyyy this gym is exactly what I had in mind and MORE!

Dumbbells: Titan Fitness SET RUBBER HEX DUMBBELLS

Kettlebells: Titan Fitness CAST IRON KETTLEBELLS

Box Jump: Titan Fitness 3-IN-1 HEAVY FOAM PLYOMETRIC BOX 

Battle Ropes: Titan Fitness 50 FT X 2-IN BATTLE ROPE

Tonal

Peloton

Neon Sign: Neon Signs Co  CODE: Katie30 for $30 off!!! 

Mirror: Wall Mirror Kit For Gym

Mats: Large Exercise Mat for at home gym

Outdoor space:

This outdoor space is just so peaceful and serene! I love coming out here in the morning to sit and and have my morning coffee and reset before I start my day! The furniture is all from Malibu Market Design, they don’t have everything they offer listed on their website, I actually went to their showroom and picked out custom pieces that matched my aesthetic and color story!

Furniture: Malibu Market Design

Fire pit: Belle Concrete Propane Outdoor Gas Fire Pit Table from Wayfair 

Kitchen:

This kitchen is my happy place!!! You guys know how much I love cooking and making up recipes and now I have this beautiful, bright and open space to create SO MANY FUN recipes for you guys!!!! I actually thoroughly enjoy waking up putting the dishes away and keeping this space clean! (Who am I?!?) but seriously I’m obsessed with how much space I have here and I’m just SO EXCITED! DREAM KITCHEN.

All of my dish ware is from Pottery Barn: Larkin Reactive Glaze Stonewear 16-Piece Dinnerware Set 

This cute vase is from CB2: Victoria Black Vase 

Pampas Grass is also from CB2: Faux Pamapas Grass Set of 3

Glassware is from Anthropologie:  Waterfall Wine Glasses

Black Soap Pump: https://www.cb2.com/parello-pleated-black-soap-pump/s469162

Closet:

Hamper: https://www.cb2.com/grey-shagreen-hamper/s598528

(we have one each, we’re obsessed with them!)

ALRIGHTY YALL! I will be constantly adding to this blog as I add to my house! Everything not linked is probably something that is very old, bought local, or built in to the house. Thanks for readinggggg!!!

At first it all seemed a little overwhelming, trying to figure out furniture and design for the house because I'm NOT a creative aesthetic person hahah but I ended up being obsessed with this process. The key word for this is PATIENCE. It's only been six weeks since we moved in, but at I started ordering and purchasing furniture a month prior to moving in.
